mpc.controller module

class mpc.controller.Controller[source]

Bases: object

Abstract Base Class for control implementation.

abstract solve()[source]

Returns a dictionary sol_dict with control input to apply, as well as other useful information (e.g. MPC solution).

In particular, sol_dict must have a key “u_control” such that

sol_dict[“u_control”][0] = acceleration input to apply sol_dict[“u_control”][1] = steering input to apply

abstract update(update_dict)[source]

Updates the state of the controller with feedback info contained in update_dict.

mpc.mpc_controller module

class mpc.mpc_controller.KinMPCPathFollower(N=10, DT=0.2, L_F=1.5213, L_R=1.4987, V_MIN=0.0, V_MAX=25.0, A_MIN=-3.0, A_MAX=2.0, DF_MIN=-0.5, DF_MAX=0.5, A_DOT_MIN=-1.5, A_DOT_MAX=1.5, DF_DOT_MIN=-0.5, DF_DOT_MAX=0.5, Q=[1.0, 1.0, 10.0, 0.1], R=[10.0, 100.0], F=[0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 10.0], **kwargs)[source]

global_path_callback(msg: feb_msgs.msg.FebPath)[source]

Input: msg.PathState -> List of State (from State.msg) vectors Returns: List of numpy state vectors (len 4: x, y, velocity, heading) Description: Takes in a local or global path depending on what lap we’re in and converts to np.array of state vectors

local_path_callback(msg: feb_msgs.msg.FebPath)[source]

Input: msg.PathState -> List of State (from State.msg) vectors Returns: List of numpy state vectors (len 4: x, y, velocity, heading) Description: Takes in a local or global path depending on what lap we’re in and converts to np.array of state vectors

pointcloud_pub

  1. Parameters

solve()[source]

Returns: sol_dict (solution variables and other data related to solve) -> see below for specific info Description: self.opti.solve() uses casadi to find solution to mpc problem and publishes control to apply

state_callback(carstate: feb_msgs.msg.State)[source]

Input: Float64[4] Description: Converts State msg to numpy vector,

updates variables initalized in __init__ (e.g. self.z_ref, self.z_curr, etc.) with get_update_dict and self.update, and solves mpc problem -> stores result in self.prev_soln

steer_callback(msg: WheelSpeeds)[source]

Return Steering Angle from steering angle sensor on car

update(update_dict)[source]

Input: - update_dict: all mpc variables to be updated Description: calls _update_initial_condition, _update_reference, and _update_previous_input to actually update

mpc.mpc_settings module

mpc.track_constraints module

mpc.track_constraints.get_full_g(left, right, **opts)[source]
mpc.track_constraints.get_g_one_side(path, **opts)[source]

gets a function g(x): R²->R approximating the turning number of path about x

Parameters:

  • path (numpy.ndarray) – array of points to convert to path. must be 2-index, and one index must be length 2.

  • interp_method (str, optional) – the interpolation method to use. see docs for casadi.interpolant. Defaults to ‘linear’.

  • n_points (int, optional) – number of points along the path to sample for the approximation. Defaults to the number of points in path.

Returns:

The function g(x)

Return type:

casadi.Function
